NAME: rcfg_enable
DESCRIPTION: Enables the dynamic reconfiguration interface.

NAME: rcfg_jtag_enable
DISPLAY_NAME: Enable Native PHY Debug Master Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, the PLL IP includes an embedded Native PHY Debug Master Endpoint that connects internally Avalon-MM slave interface. The Native PHY Debug Master Endpoint can access the reconfiguration space of the transceiver. It can perform certain test and debug functions via JTAG using the System Console. This option requires you to enable the Share reconfiguration interface" option for configurations using more than 1 channel and may also require that a jtag_debug link be included in the system."

NAME: rcfg_separate_avmm_busy
DISPLAY_NAME: Separate reconfig_waitrequest from the status of AVMM arbitration with PreSICE
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, the reconfig_waitrequest will not indicate the status of AVMM arbitration with PreSICE.  The AVMM arbitration status will be reflected in a soft status register bit.  This feature requires that the Enable control and status registers" feature under "Optional Reconfiguration Logic" be enabled.  For more information
column6: please refer to the User Guide."

NAME: rcfg_enable_avmm_busy_port
DESCRIPTION: Enable the port for avmm_busy

NAME: set_capability_reg_enable
DESCRIPTION: Enables capability registers, which provide high level information about the transceiver PLL's configuration

NAME: set_user_identifier
DESCRIPTION: Sets a user-defined numeric identifier that can be read from the user_identifer offset when the capability registers are enabled

NAME: set_csr_soft_logic_enable
DESCRIPTION: Enables soft registers for reading status signals and writing control signals on the phy interface through the embedded debug. Available signals include pll_cal_busy, pll_locked and pll_powerdown.  For more details, please refer to the User Guide.

NAME: rcfg_file_prefix
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the file prefix to use for generated configuration files when enabled. Each variant of the IP should use a unique prefix for configuration files.

NAME: rcfg_files_as_common_package
DISPLAY_NAME: Declare SystemVerilog package file as common package file
DESCRIPTION: Declares the SystemVerilog reconfig file as common package.

NAME: rcfg_sv_file_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, The IP will generate a SystemVerilog package file named (Configuration file prefix)_reconfig_parameters.sv" containing parameters defined with the attribute values needed for reconfiguration."

NAME: rcfg_h_file_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, The IP will generate a C header file named (Configuration file prefix)_reconfig_parameters.h" containing macros defined with the attribute values needed for reconfiguration."

NAME: rcfg_txt_file_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, The IP will generate a text file named (Configuration file prefix)_reconfig_parameters.txt" containing the attribute values needed for reconfiguration."

NAME: rcfg_mif_file_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled The IP will generate an Altera MIF (Memory Initialization File) named (Configuration file prefix)_reconfig_parameters.mif". The MIF file contains the attribute values needed for reconfiguration in a data format."

NAME: rcfg_multi_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, you can use the GUI to store multiple configurations. The IP will generate reconfiguration files for all of the stored profiles. The IP will also check your multiple reconfiguration profiles for consistency to ensure you can reconfigure between them.

NAME: set_rcfg_emb_strm_enable
DESCRIPTION: Enables the embedded reconfiguration streamer, which automates the dynamic reconfiguration process between multiple predefined configuration profiles.

NAME: rcfg_reduced_files_enable
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, The Native PHY generates reconfiguration report files containing only the attributes or RAM data that are different between the multiple configured profiles.

NAME: rcfg_profile_cnt
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the number of reconfiguration profiles to support when multiple reconfiguration profiles are enabled.

NAME: rcfg_profile_select
DESCRIPTION: Selects which reconfiguration profile to store when clicking the Store profile" button."

NAME: rcfg_profile_data0
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 0

NAME: rcfg_profile_data1
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 1

NAME: rcfg_profile_data2
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 2

NAME: rcfg_profile_data3
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 3

NAME: rcfg_profile_data4
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 4

NAME: rcfg_profile_data5
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 5

NAME: rcfg_profile_data6
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 6

NAME: rcfg_profile_data7
DESCRIPTION: Dynamic reconfiguration parameter data for Profile 7

NAME: generate_docs
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, generation will produce a .CSV file with descriptions of the IP parameters.

NAME: generate_add_hdl_instance_example
DESCRIPTION: When enabled, generation will produce a file containing an example of how to use the '_hw.tcl' 'add_hdl_instance' API. The example will be correct for the current configuration of the IP.

NAME: set_x1_core_clock
DESCRIPTION: The divide by 1 clock output is always enabled in core mode. No phase relations to refclk

NAME: set_x2_core_clock
DESCRIPTION: Enable the divide by 2 clock in core mode. Phase aligned to divide by 1 clock.

NAME: set_x4_core_clock
DESCRIPTION: Enable the divide by 4 clock in core mode. Phase aligned to divide by 1 clock

NAME: set_primary_use
DESCRIPTION: Selects the primary operation mode of the FPLL (Core/Transceiver/Cascade source.

NAME: test_mode
DESCRIPTION: Selects the test mode option to bypass VCO primarily.

NAME: usr_enable_vco_bypass
DESCRIPTION: Selects the support mode (user or engineering). Engineering mode options are not officially supported by Intel or Quartus Prime.

NAME: support_mode
DESCRIPTION: Selects the support mode (user or engineering). Engineering mode options are not officially supported by Intel or Quartus Prime.

NAME: message_level
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the messaging level to use for parameter rule violations. Selecting error" will cause all rule violations to prevent IP generation. Selecting "warning" will display all rule violations as warnings and will allow IP generation in spite of violations."

NAME: set_prot_mode
DESCRIPTION: The parameter is used to govern the rules for internal settings of the VCO. This parameter is not a preset". You must still correctly set all other parameters for your protocol and application."

NAME: set_bw_sel
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the VCO bandwidth.

NAME: set_refclk_cnt
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the number of input reference clocks for the FPLL.

NAME: set_refclk_index
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the initially selected reference clock input to the FPLL.

NAME: set_enable_hclk_out
DESCRIPTION: This is the 1 GHz fixed PCIe clock output port and is intended for PIPE mode. The port should be connected to pipe hclk input port"."

NAME: enable_hip_cal_done_port
DISPLAY_NAME: Enable calibration status ports for HIP
DESCRIPTION: Enables calibration status port from PLL and Master CGB(if enabled) for HIP

NAME: enable_mcgb_hip_cal_done_port
DISPLAY_NAME: Enable MCGB calibration status ports for HIP
DESCRIPTION: Enables calibration status port from PLL and Master CGB(if enabled) for HIP

NAME: set_hip_cal_en
DESCRIPTION: INTERNAL USE ONLY. Enabling this parameter prioritizes the calibration for PCIe hard IP channels.

NAME: set_output_clock_frequency
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the target output frequency for the PLL.

NAME: set_manual_output_clock_frequency
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the target output frequency for the PLL in manual mode.

NAME: set_enable_fractional
DESCRIPTION: Enables the fractional frequency synthesis mode. This enables the PLL to output frequencies which are not integral multiples of the input reference clock.

NAME: set_auto_reference_clock_frequency
DISPLAY_NAME: PLL integer mode reference clock frequency
DESCRIPTION: Selects the input reference clock frequency for the PLL.

NAME: set_manual_reference_clock_frequency
DESCRIPTION: Specify the PLL reference clock frequency.

NAME: set_fref_clock_frequency
DISPLAY_NAME: PLL fractional mode reference clock frequency
DESCRIPTION: Selects the fractional reference clock frequency for the PLL.

NAME: set_initial_phase_shift_units
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the initial phase shift units.

NAME: set_initial_phase_shift
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the initial phase shift w.r.t the output clock frequency.

NAME: set_enable_dps
DESCRIPTION: Enables dynamic phase shift via core ports.

NAME: select_manual_config
DESCRIPTION: Enables manual control of PLL counters.

NAME: set_manual_m_counter
DESCRIPTION: M counter value in manual mode

NAME: set_manual_ref_clk_div
DESCRIPTION: N counter value in manual mode

NAME: set_manual_l_counter
DESCRIPTION: L counter value in manual mode

NAME: set_manual_c_counter
DESCRIPTION: C counter value in manual mode

NAME: set_manual_k_counter
DESCRIPTION: K counter value in manual mode

NAME: set_altera_xcvr_fpll_s10_calibration_en
DESCRIPTION: Enable transceiver calibration algorithms.

NAME: set_power_mode
DISPLAY_NAME: VCCR_GXB and VCCT_GXB supply voltage for the Transceiver:
DESCRIPTION: Sets the voltage compatibility with the associated Native Phy IP

NAME: enable_analog_resets
DESCRIPTION: Enable pll_powerdown port

NAME: enable_mcgb
DESCRIPTION: When enabled Master CGB will be included as part of the IP. PLL output will feed the Master CGB input.

NAME: mcgb_div
DESCRIPTION: Divides the Master CGB clock input before generating bonding clocks.

NAME: enable_hfreq_clk
DISPLAY_NAME: Enable x24 non-bonded high-speed clock output port
DESCRIPTION: This output port can be used to access x6/xN clock lines for non-bonded designs

NAME: enable_mcgb_pcie_clksw
DESCRIPTION: Enables the control signals for PCIe clock switch circuitry

NAME: enable_mcgb_reset
DESCRIPTION: Enables the mcgb_rst and mcgb_rst_stat ports. Use these ports to control the reset of master CGB for PCIE Gen 3 x2/x4/x8/x16 configuration. Refer to Stratix 10 user guide for the reset sequence of PCIE Gen3 multi-lane configurations.

NAME: mcgb_aux_clkin_cnt
DISPLAY_NAME: Number of auxiliary MCGB clock input ports.
DESCRIPTION: Auxiliary input is intended for PCIe Gen3, hence not available in FPLL

NAME: enable_bonding_clks
DESCRIPTION: Should be enable for bonded designs

NAME: pma_width
DESCRIPTION: PMA-PCS Interface width. Proper value must be selected for bonding clocks to be generated properly for Native PHY IP.
